subject: Re: [junit] JUnit populating method tests in testcase
msgSnippet: ... My JUnit doesn t. My JUnit just collects my test methods. ... Are you sure JUnit does this? I d suspect your IDE does this. ... Why not just change the
messageBody:
On Friday 20 February 2004 13:36, humbugzilla wrote:
> When creating a new testcase, JUnit offers to populate the testcase

My JUnit doesn't.
My JUnit just collects my test methods.

> 1. I would like a checkbox which means add all those testmethods but
> commented out initially. This would save my usual next action which is
> to go through manually commenting them out - in some classes, this is
> a lot of work.

Are you sure JUnit does this? I'd suspect your IDE does this.

> 2. I would like to see a checkbox and textfield which would allow me
> to append a suffix to each testmethod. At my present stage of using
> JUnit, I find I start out with the test method given me by JUnit
> automagically, then I populate the body with my test, then I
> copy/paste the testmethod, add 001 to the end of the first of them,
> 002 to the end of the second one, and go on to edit the body of the
> second of these testmethods.

Why not just change the name to whatever the test does, like
testFooDoesBar or testFooDoesThrowOnBarArg?

If you copy your test code, consider moving the duplicated code to
setUp().

> 3. It would be great if while viewing an existing testcase file, I
> could bring up some JUnit wizard that lets me add more testmethod(s)
> from the base or, I guess, even some other, class.

My keyboard is my wizard...

Robert
